text:
♪ It was me, it was you,
all the things we could do ♪

♪ And we talked underneath
apple trees ♪
♪ All our dreams, everything ♪
♪ That we hope we could be ♪

♪ Wanted more than
we're supposed to believe ♪

♪ They told me
I can't do that ♪
♪ Said I'm a kid, go back ♪
♪ But I know what I have ♪
♪ Nothing can stop us now ♪

It's official,
your new pre-chorus

is the best thing
I've ever heard.

Well, only because
of your chord progression.

Stop.
You're just saying that.

You know, I really think
we have a shot

- at the song-writing comp.
- Can you imagine?
Performing with Gwen Taylor?

Heather: Can you guys
just smooch already?

- Heather!
- I'm reading out loud.
Really?

"Can you two smooch already?"
is a line from
"The Chronicles of Pixie Ridge?"
Yeah, I don't believe that.

- Get out.
- No.
I'm sorry you have to see this.
Heather: No! Holly!
( muttering )

- Heather: No! No, no, no.
- ( banging on door )

No, Holly!
Let me back in. No!

Remind me never
to mess with you.
Where were we? Um, right.
Writing an instant classic.
Heather: Dad!

- Dad!
- What's the emergency?
Is something burning?
Just me. With rage.

♪ 'Cause I know I could do
anything with you ♪

- ( knocking on door )
- Dad: Uh, Holly?
Oh, one second.

- Can you open up please?
- Yeah.

- Sorry, are we being too loud?
- Hey. Hi.

I couldn't help but notice
there's a guy in your room.

Uh, yeah. Dad, Oscar.
Oscar, Dad.

- Hi.
- You're very good-looking.
Oh, uh, thank you, sir.

Except, it's, uh-- it's
getting kind of late, so...

Oh, yeah.
I can come back later.

- Uh, great work today.
- No, you don't have to go.

- Dad, we're not done yet.
- Except that you are.

Except that we need
to finish the song.

The submission
deadline is coming up.

Uh, you have a big test
to study for this week.

You can't study
for the common core.
Also, my house, my rules.
Can't argue with that.

We'll just finish
where we left off next time.

- Dad?
- We'll talk about this later.
Hi.
